DOC.brief_summary: NICOM® recently develop noninvasive cardiac output monitoring device , index derive NICOM® SVV report predict fluid responsiveness previous study . However , usefulness prone positioning investigate . Thus , aim prospective observational study evaluate usefulness stroke volume variation ( SVV ) derive NICOM® predict fluid responsiveness prone patient undergoing spine surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation SVV From NICOM Predictor Fluid Responsiveness Prone Position During Spine Surgery
DOC.criteria: ASA I II patient undergo spine surgery prone position Preexisting arrhythmic disorders/moderate severe valvular heart disease/obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD grade > 2 ) , leave ventricular dysfunction LV EF less 50 , preoperative need inotropics vasopressor BMI > 30kg/m^2 < 15kg/m^2 Preoperative serum Cr > 1.3mg/dL Patients coagulopathy
